message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about lightbulbs and the physics of light. A byproduct of a lightbulb is warmth. When electricity passes through the filament of a lightbulb, it heats up and emits light. This lightbulb also emits some amount of heat energy as a byproduct. Option (A) is incorrect because taste is not related to lightbulbs. Option (B) is not always true and is not directly related to lightbulbs. Option (D) is incorrect because lightbulbs do not produce sound.
